trans-unit.source: Manage statistics in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage statistics in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for managing statistics in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for managing statistics in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Manage statistics in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Manage statistics in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse uses statistics to assess the cost of different ways to perform a distributed query.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse uses statistics to assess the cost of different ways to perform a distributed query.

trans-unit.source: When statistics are accurate, the query optimizer can generate high quality query plans that improve query performance.
trans-unit.target: When statistics are accurate, the query optimizer can generate high quality query plans that improve query performance.

trans-unit.source: Creating and updating statistics is important in order to achieve the query performance that SQL Data Warehouse is designed to provide.
trans-unit.target: Creating and updating statistics is important in order to achieve the query performance that SQL Data Warehouse is designed to provide.

trans-unit.source: This guide gives an overview of statistics, and then shows how to:
trans-unit.target: This guide gives an overview of statistics, and then shows how to:

trans-unit.source: Create statistics as part of database design
trans-unit.target: Create statistics as part of database design

trans-unit.source: Update statistics as part of database maintenance
trans-unit.target: Update statistics as part of database maintenance

trans-unit.source: View statistics with system views and functions
trans-unit.target: View statistics with system views and functions

trans-unit.source: Introducing statistics
trans-unit.target: Introducing statistics

trans-unit.source: Single-column statistics are objects that contain information about the range and frequency of values in a single column.
trans-unit.target: Single-column statistics are objects that contain information about the range and frequency of values in a single column.

trans-unit.source: The query optimizer uses this histogram to estimate the number of rows in the query result.
trans-unit.target: The query optimizer uses this histogram to estimate the number of rows in the query result.

trans-unit.source: This directly impacts decisions about how to optimize the query.
trans-unit.target: This directly impacts decisions about how to optimize the query.

trans-unit.source: Multi-column statistics are statistics created on a list of columns.
trans-unit.target: Multi-column statistics are statistics created on a list of columns.

trans-unit.source: They include single column statistics on the first column in the list, plus some cross-column correlation information called densities.
trans-unit.target: They include single column statistics on the first column in the list, plus some cross-column correlation information called densities.

trans-unit.source: Multi-column statistics can improve query performance for some operations such as composite joins and group by's.
trans-unit.target: Multi-column statistics can improve query performance for some operations such as composite joins and group by's.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS[]</linkText><title></title></link> on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS[]</linkText><title></title></link> on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Why are statistics necessary?
trans-unit.target: Why are statistics necessary?

trans-unit.source: Without proper statistics, you will not get the performance that SQL Data Warehouse is designed to provide.
trans-unit.target: Without proper statistics, you will not get the performance that SQL Data Warehouse is designed to provide.

trans-unit.source: Tables and columns and columns do not have statistics automatically generated by SQL Data Warehouse and so you need to create them yourself.
trans-unit.target: Tables and columns and columns do not have statistics automatically generated by SQL Data Warehouse and so you need to create them yourself.

trans-unit.source: It's a good idea to create them when you create the table and then update them once you have populated them.
trans-unit.target: It's a good idea to create them when you create the table and then update them once you have populated them.

trans-unit.source: If you use SQL Server, you might depend on SQL Server to create and update single-column statistics for you as needed.
trans-unit.target: If you use SQL Server, you might depend on SQL Server to create and update single-column statistics for you as needed.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse is different in this aspect.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse is different in this aspect.

trans-unit.source: Since the data is distributed, SQL Data Warehouse doesn't automatically aggregate statistics across all the distributed data.
trans-unit.target: Since the data is distributed, SQL Data Warehouse doesn't automatically aggregate statistics across all the distributed data.

trans-unit.source: It will only generate the aggregated statistics when you create and update statistics.
trans-unit.target: It will only generate the aggregated statistics when you create and update statistics.

trans-unit.source: When to create statistics
trans-unit.target: When to create statistics

trans-unit.source: A coherent set of up-to-date statistics is an important part of SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: A coherent set of up-to-date statistics is an important part of SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: It is therefore important to create statistics as part of designing your tables.
trans-unit.target: It is therefore important to create statistics as part of designing your tables.

trans-unit.source: Creating single-column statistics on every column is an easy way to get started with statistics.
trans-unit.target: Creating single-column statistics on every column is an easy way to get started with statistics.

trans-unit.source: However, there are always trade-offs between performance and the cost to create and update statistics.
trans-unit.target: However, there are always trade-offs between performance and the cost to create and update statistics.

trans-unit.source: If you create single-column statistics on all columns and later find it is taking too long to update all statistics, you can always drop some of the statistics, or update some of them more often than others.
trans-unit.target: If you create single-column statistics on all columns and later find it is taking too long to update all statistics, you can always drop some of the statistics, or update some of them more often than others.

trans-unit.source: Multi-column statistics are only used by the query optimizer when the columns are in composite joins or group by clauses.
trans-unit.target: Multi-column statistics are only used by the query optimizer when the columns are in composite joins or group by clauses.

trans-unit.source: Composite filters do not currently benefit from multi-column statistics.
trans-unit.target: Composite filters do not currently benefit from multi-column statistics.

trans-unit.source: When starting your SQL Data Warehouse development therefore it is a good idea to implement the following pattern:
trans-unit.target: When starting your SQL Data Warehouse development therefore it is a good idea to implement the following pattern:

trans-unit.source: Create single-column statistics on every column on every table
trans-unit.target: Create single-column statistics on every column on every table

trans-unit.source: Create multi-column statistics on the columns used by queries in joins and group by clauses.
trans-unit.target: Create multi-column statistics on the columns used by queries in joins and group by clauses.

trans-unit.source: As you understand how you want to query your data you might want to refine this model - especially when the tables are wide.
trans-unit.target: As you understand how you want to query your data you might want to refine this model - especially when the tables are wide.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the [Implementing statistics management](## Implementing statistics management) section for a more advanced method approach.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the [Implementing statistics management](## Implementing statistics management) section for a more advanced method approach.

trans-unit.source: When to update statistics
trans-unit.target: When to update statistics

trans-unit.source: It is important to include updating statistics in your database management routine.
trans-unit.target: It is important to include updating statistics in your database management routine.

trans-unit.source: When the distribution of data in the database changes, statistics need to be updated.
trans-unit.target: When the distribution of data in the database changes, statistics need to be updated.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you can see sub-optimal query performance, and efforts to further troubleshoot the query might not be worthwhile.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you can see sub-optimal query performance, and efforts to further troubleshoot the query might not be worthwhile.

trans-unit.source: Therefore one of the first questions to ask when troubleshooting a query is, "Are the statistics up-to-date?"
trans-unit.target: Therefore one of the first questions to ask when troubleshooting a query is, "Are the statistics up-to-date?"

trans-unit.source: This question is not one that can be answered by age.
trans-unit.target: This question is not one that can be answered by age.

trans-unit.source: An up to date statistics object could be very old.
trans-unit.target: An up to date statistics object could be very old.

trans-unit.source: When the number of rows or there is a material change in the distribution of values for a given column then you need to update statistics.
trans-unit.target: When the number of rows or there is a material change in the distribution of values for a given column then you need to update statistics.

trans-unit.source: For example, date columns in a data warehouse usually needs frequent statistics updates.
trans-unit.target: For example, date columns in a data warehouse usually needs frequent statistics updates.

trans-unit.source: Each time new rows are loaded into the data warehouse, new load dates or transaction dates are added.
trans-unit.target: Each time new rows are loaded into the data warehouse, new load dates or transaction dates are added.

trans-unit.source: These change the data distribution and make the statistics out-of-date.
trans-unit.target: These change the data distribution and make the statistics out-of-date.

trans-unit.source: Conversely, statistics on a gender column on a customer table might never need to be updated.
trans-unit.target: Conversely, statistics on a gender column on a customer table might never need to be updated.

trans-unit.source: Assuming the distribution is constant between customers, adding new rows to the table variation isn't going to change the data distribution.
trans-unit.target: Assuming the distribution is constant between customers, adding new rows to the table variation isn't going to change the data distribution.

trans-unit.source: However, if your data warehouse only contains one gender and a new requirement results in multiple genders then you definitely need to update statistics on the gender column.
trans-unit.target: However, if your data warehouse only contains one gender and a new requirement results in multiple genders then you definitely need to update statistics on the gender column.

trans-unit.source: For further explanation, see <link><linkText>Statistics[]</linkText><title></title></link> on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: For further explanation, see <link><linkText>Statistics[]</linkText><title></title></link> on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Implementing statistics management
trans-unit.target: Implementing statistics management

trans-unit.source: It is often a good idea to extend your data loading process to ensure that statistics are updated at the end of the load.
trans-unit.target: It is often a good idea to extend your data loading process to ensure that statistics are updated at the end of the load.

trans-unit.source: The data load is when tables most frequently change their size and/or their distribution of values.
trans-unit.target: The data load is when tables most frequently change their size and/or their distribution of values.

trans-unit.source: Therefore this is a logical place to implement some management processes.
trans-unit.target: Therefore this is a logical place to implement some management processes.

trans-unit.source: Some guiding principles are provided below for updating your statistics during the load process:
trans-unit.target: Some guiding principles are provided below for updating your statistics during the load process:

trans-unit.source: Ensure that each loaded table has at least one statistics object updated.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that each loaded table has at least one statistics object updated.

trans-unit.source: This updates the tables size (row count and page count) information as part of the stats update.
trans-unit.target: This updates the tables size (row count and page count) information as part of the stats update.

trans-unit.source: Focus on columns participating in JOIN, GROUP BY, ORDER BY and DISTINCT clauses
trans-unit.target: Focus on columns participating in JOIN, GROUP BY, ORDER BY and DISTINCT clauses

trans-unit.source: Consider updating "ascending key" columns such as transaction dates more frequently as these values will not be included in the statistics histogram.
trans-unit.target: Consider updating "ascending key" columns such as transaction dates more frequently as these values will not be included in the statistics histogram.

trans-unit.source: Consider updating static distribution columns less frequently.
trans-unit.target: Consider updating static distribution columns less frequently.

trans-unit.source: Remember each statistic object is updated in series. Simply implementing UPDATE STATISTICS may not be ideal - especially for wide tables with lots of statistics objects.
trans-unit.target: Remember each statistic object is updated in series. Simply implementing UPDATE STATISTICS may not be ideal - especially for wide tables with lots of statistics objects.

trans-unit.source: For more details on [ascending key] please refer to the SQL Server 2014 cardinality estimation model whitepaper.
trans-unit.target: For more details on [ascending key] please refer to the SQL Server 2014 cardinality estimation model whitepaper.

trans-unit.source: For further explanation, see <link><linkText>Cardinality Estimation[]</linkText><title></title></link> on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: For further explanation, see <link><linkText>Cardinality Estimation[]</linkText><title></title></link> on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Examples: Create statistics
trans-unit.target: Examples: Create statistics

trans-unit.source: These examples show how to use various options for creating statistics.
trans-unit.target: These examples show how to use various options for creating statistics.

trans-unit.source: The options that you use for each column depend on the characteristics of your data and how the column will be used in queries.
trans-unit.target: The options that you use for each column depend on the characteristics of your data and how the column will be used in queries.

trans-unit.source: A. Create single-column statistics with default options
trans-unit.target: A. Create single-column statistics with default options

trans-unit.source: To create statistics on a column, simply provide a name for the statistics object and the name of the column.
trans-unit.target: To create statistics on a column, simply provide a name for the statistics object and the name of the column.

trans-unit.source: This syntax uses all of the default options.
trans-unit.target: This syntax uses all of the default options.

trans-unit.source: By default, SQL Data Warehouse samples 20 percent of the table when it creates statistics.
trans-unit.target: By default, SQL Data Warehouse samples 20 percent of the table when it creates statistics.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: B. Create single-column statistics by examining every row
trans-unit.target: B. Create single-column statistics by examining every row

trans-unit.source: The default sampling rate of 20 percent is sufficient for most situations.
trans-unit.target: The default sampling rate of 20 percent is sufficient for most situations.

trans-unit.source: However, you can adjust the sampling rate.
trans-unit.target: However, you can adjust the sampling rate.

trans-unit.source: To sample the full table, use this syntax:
trans-unit.target: To sample the full table, use this syntax:

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: C. Create single-column statistics by specifying the sample size
trans-unit.target: C. Create single-column statistics by specifying the sample size

trans-unit.source: Alternatively you can specify the sample size as a percent:
trans-unit.target: Alternatively you can specify the sample size as a percent:

trans-unit.source: D. Create single-column statistics on only some of the rows
trans-unit.target: D. Create single-column statistics on only some of the rows

trans-unit.source: Another option, you can create statistics on a portion of the rows in your table.
trans-unit.target: Another option, you can create statistics on a portion of the rows in your table.

trans-unit.source: This is called a filtered statistic.
trans-unit.target: This is called a filtered statistic.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could use filtered statistics when you plan to query a specific partition of a large partitioned table.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could use filtered statistics when you plan to query a specific partition of a large partitioned table.

trans-unit.source: By creating statistics on only the partition values, the accuracy of the statistics will improve, and therefore improve query performance.
trans-unit.target: By creating statistics on only the partition values, the accuracy of the statistics will improve, and therefore improve query performance.

trans-unit.source: This example creates statistics on a range of values.
trans-unit.target: This example creates statistics on a range of values.

trans-unit.source: The values could easily be defined to match the range of values in a partition.
trans-unit.target: The values could easily be defined to match the range of values in a partition.

trans-unit.source: For the query optimizer to consider using filtered statistics when it chooses the distributed query plan, the query must fit inside the definition of the statistics object.
trans-unit.target: For the query optimizer to consider using filtered statistics when it chooses the distributed query plan, the query must fit inside the definition of the statistics object.

trans-unit.source: Using the previous example, the query's where clause needs to specify col1 values between 2000101 and 20001231.
trans-unit.target: Using the previous example, the query's where clause needs to specify col1 values between 2000101 and 20001231.

trans-unit.source: E. Create single-column statistics with all the options
trans-unit.target: E. Create single-column statistics with all the options

trans-unit.source: You can, of course, combine the options together.
trans-unit.target: You can, of course, combine the options together.

trans-unit.source: The example below creates a filtered statistics object with a custom sample size:
trans-unit.target: The example below creates a filtered statistics object with a custom sample size:

trans-unit.source: For the full reference, see <link><linkText>CREATE STATISTICS[]</linkText><title></title></link> on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: For the full reference, see <link><linkText>CREATE STATISTICS[]</linkText><title></title></link> on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: F. Create multi-column statistics
trans-unit.target: F. Create multi-column statistics

trans-unit.source: To create a multi-column statistics, simply use the previous examples, but specify more columns.
trans-unit.target: To create a multi-column statistics, simply use the previous examples, but specify more columns.

trans-unit.source: The histogram, which is used to estimate number of rows in the query result, is only available for the first column listed in the statistics object definition.
trans-unit.target: The histogram, which is used to estimate number of rows in the query result, is only available for the first column listed in the statistics object definition.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the histogram is on product\_category.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the histogram is on product\_category.

trans-unit.source: Cross-column statistics are calculated on product\_category and product\_sub_c\ategory:
trans-unit.target: Cross-column statistics are calculated on product\_category and product\_sub_c\ategory:

trans-unit.source: Since there is a correlation between product\_category and product\_sub\_category, a multi-column stat can be useful if these columns are accessed at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Since there is a correlation between product\_category and product\_sub\_category, a multi-column stat can be useful if these columns are accessed at the same time.

trans-unit.source: G. Create statistics on all the columns in a table
trans-unit.target: G. Create statistics on all the columns in a table

trans-unit.source: One way to create statistics is to issues CREATE STATISTICS commands after creating the table.
trans-unit.target: One way to create statistics is to issues CREATE STATISTICS commands after creating the table.

trans-unit.source: H. Use a stored procedure to create statistics on all columns in a database
trans-unit.target: H. Use a stored procedure to create statistics on all columns in a database

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse does not have a system stored procedure equivalent to <link><linkText>sp_create_stats[]</linkText><title></title></link> in SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse does not have a system stored procedure equivalent to <link><linkText>sp_create_stats[]</linkText><title></title></link> in SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: This stored procedure creates a single column statistics object on every column of the database that doesn't already have statistics.
trans-unit.target: This stored procedure creates a single column statistics object on every column of the database that doesn't already have statistics.

trans-unit.source: This will help you get started with your database design.
trans-unit.target: This will help you get started with your database design.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to adapt it to your needs.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to adapt it to your needs.

trans-unit.source: To create statistics on all columns in the table with this procedure, simply call the procedure.
trans-unit.target: To create statistics on all columns in the table with this procedure, simply call the procedure.

trans-unit.source: UPDATE STATISTICS [schema_name].<link><linkText>table_name</linkText><title></title></link>;
trans-unit.target: UPDATE STATISTICS [schema_name].<link><linkText>table_name</linkText><title></title></link>;

trans-unit.source: UPDATE STATISTICS [dbo].[table1] ([stats_col1]);
trans-unit.target: UPDATE STATISTICS [dbo].[table1] ([stats_col1]);

trans-unit.source: UPDATE STATISTICS [schema_name].[table_name];
trans-unit.target: UPDATE STATISTICS [schema_name].[table_name];

trans-unit.source: UPDATE STATISTICS dbo.table1;
trans-unit.target: UPDATE STATISTICS dbo.table1;

trans-unit.source: CREATE VIEW dbo.vstats_columns
trans-unit.target: CREATE VIEW dbo.vstats_columns

trans-unit.source: AS
trans-unit.target: AS

trans-unit.source: SELECT
trans-unit.target: SELECT

trans-unit.source: sm.[name] AS [schema_name]
trans-unit.target: sm.[name] AS [schema_name]

trans-unit.source: , tb.[name] AS [table_name]
trans-unit.target: , tb.[name] AS [table_name]

trans-unit.source: , st.[name] AS [stats_name]
trans-unit.target: , st.[name] AS [stats_name]

trans-unit.source: , st.[filter_definition] AS [stats_filter_defiinition]
trans-unit.target: , st.[filter_definition] AS [stats_filter_defiinition]

trans-unit.source: , st.[has_filter] AS [stats_is_filtered]
trans-unit.target: , st.[has_filter] AS [stats_is_filtered]

trans-unit.source: , STATS_DATE(st.[object_id],st.[stats_id])
trans-unit.target: , STATS_DATE(st.[object_id],st.[stats_id])

trans-unit.source: AS [stats_last_updated_date]
trans-unit.target: AS [stats_last_updated_date]

trans-unit.source: , co.[name] AS [stats_column_name]
trans-unit.target: , co.[name] AS [stats_column_name]

trans-unit.source: , ty.[name] AS [column_type]
trans-unit.target: , ty.[name] AS [column_type]

trans-unit.source: , co.[max_length] AS [column_max_length]
trans-unit.target: , co.[max_length] AS [column_max_length]

trans-unit.source: , co.[precision] AS [column_precision]
trans-unit.target: , co.[precision] AS [column_precision]

trans-unit.source: , co.[scale] AS [column_scale]
trans-unit.target: , co.[scale] AS [column_scale]

trans-unit.source: , co.[is_nullable] AS [column_is_nullable]
trans-unit.target: , co.[is_nullable] AS [column_is_nullable]

trans-unit.source: , co.[collation_name] AS [column_collation_name]
trans-unit.target: , co.[collation_name] AS [column_collation_name]

trans-unit.source: , QUOTENAME(sm.[name])+'.'+QUOTENAME(tb.[name])
trans-unit.target: , QUOTENAME(sm.[name])+'.'+QUOTENAME(tb.[name])

trans-unit.source: AS two_part_name
trans-unit.target: AS two_part_name

trans-unit.source: , QUOTENAME(DB_NAME())+'.'+QUOTENAME(sm.[name])+'.'+QUOTENAME(tb.[name])
trans-unit.target: , QUOTENAME(DB_NAME())+'.'+QUOTENAME(sm.[name])+'.'+QUOTENAME(tb.[name])

trans-unit.source: AS three_part_name
trans-unit.target: AS three_part_name

trans-unit.source: FROM sys.objects AS ob
trans-unit.target: FROM sys.objects AS ob

trans-unit.source: JOIN sys.stats AS st ON ob.[object_id] = st.[object_id]
trans-unit.target: JOIN sys.stats AS st ON ob.[object_id] = st.[object_id]

trans-unit.source: JOIN sys.stats_columns AS sc ON st.[stats_id] = sc.[stats_id]
trans-unit.target: JOIN sys.stats_columns AS sc ON st.[stats_id] = sc.[stats_id]

trans-unit.source: AND st.[object_id] = sc.[object_id]
trans-unit.target: AND st.[object_id] = sc.[object_id]

trans-unit.source: JOIN sys.columns AS co ON sc.[column_id] = co.[column_id]
trans-unit.target: JOIN sys.columns AS co ON sc.[column_id] = co.[column_id]

trans-unit.source: AND sc.[object_id] = co.[object_id]
trans-unit.target: AND sc.[object_id] = co.[object_id]

trans-unit.source: JOIN sys.types AS ty ON co.[user_type_id] = ty.[user_type_id]
trans-unit.target: JOIN sys.types AS ty ON co.[user_type_id] = ty.[user_type_id]

trans-unit.source: JOIN sys.tables AS tb ON co.[object_id] = tb.[object_id]
trans-unit.target: JOIN sys.tables AS tb ON co.[object_id] = tb.[object_id]

trans-unit.source: JOIN sys.schemas AS sm ON tb.[schema_id] = sm.[schema_id]
trans-unit.target: JOIN sys.schemas AS sm ON tb.[schema_id] = sm.[schema_id]

trans-unit.source: WHERE 1=1
trans-unit.target: WHERE 1=1

trans-unit.source: AND sts.[user_created] = 1
trans-unit.target: AND sts.[user_created] = 1

trans-unit.source: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS([<html></html>.<html></html>],<html></html>)
trans-unit.target: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS([<html></html>.<html></html>],<html></html>)

trans-unit.source: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS (dbo.table1, stats_col1);
trans-unit.target: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS (dbo.table1, stats_col1);

trans-unit.source: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS([<html></html>.<html></html>],<html></html>) WITH stat_header, histogram, density_vector
trans-unit.target: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS([<html></html>.<html></html>],<html></html>) WITH stat_header, histogram, density_vector

trans-unit.source: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS (dbo.table1, stats_col1) WITH histogram, density_vector
trans-unit.target: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS (dbo.table1, stats_col1) WITH histogram, density_vector

trans-unit.source: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS() differences
trans-unit.target: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS() differences

trans-unit.source: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS() is more strictly implemented in SQL Data Warehouse compared to SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: DBCC SHOW_STATISTICS() is more strictly implemented in SQL Data Warehouse compared to SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Undocumented features are not supported
trans-unit.target: Undocumented features are not supported

trans-unit.source: Cannot use Stats_stream
trans-unit.target: Cannot use Stats_stream

trans-unit.source: Cannot join results for specific subsets of statistics data e.g. (STAT_HEADER JOIN DENSITY_VECTOR)
trans-unit.target: Cannot join results for specific subsets of statistics data e.g. (STAT_HEADER JOIN DENSITY_VECTOR)

trans-unit.source: NO_INFOMSGS cannot be set for message suppression
trans-unit.target: NO_INFOMSGS cannot be set for message suppression

trans-unit.source: Square brackets around statistics names cannot be used
trans-unit.target: Square brackets around statistics names cannot be used

trans-unit.source: Cannot use column names to identify statistics objects
trans-unit.target: Cannot use column names to identify statistics objects

trans-unit.source: Custom error 2767 is not supported
trans-unit.target: Custom error 2767 is not supported

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see <link><linkText>SQL Data Warehouse development overview[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
